result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell E Zillmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Paid at not less than $200.00 per month commencing 30 days after release from incarceration.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any taverns/bars or liquor stores.

The defendant may not have any contact with victim (T.D.)

Defendant must under go anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations if deemed necessary by P&P.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.

Eligible for community service under 973.20.
To be completed within the first year of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell E Zillmer

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing - Order sent to judge for approval

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Russell E Zillmer in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:23 PM. Ferguson - provides court with plea questionnaire as the matter is resolved. State - resolved - plead G to count #1 as alleged, #2 and #4 will be DRI, #3 - amend to City of Crandon ordinance of DC contrary to 9.947.01 with a $300 fine plus costs, count #1 - free to argue for sentence. Zillmer and Ferguson agree. Court amends count #3 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC contrary top 9.947.01, pleads G, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #4. Zillmer pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State would like the Judge to review the surveillance video of the incident but he cannot get it to come in clearly. Ferguson stipulates to a verbal resertaion by the State. State so complies and has complied with victim notification requirements and has restitution report submitted on 6/26/15. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 365 days in FC jail, fine with surcharge totalling $750.00, restitution of $1560.72 plus VW surcharge of $156.07 totalling $1716.79 - paid at no less than $200.00/month after release from incarceration and to be completed within term of probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or similar establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service, no contact with victim (T.D.). Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends an imposed and stayed sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions as seen appropriate by the Court. Zillmer withholds comment. Court reviews submissions by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: fine of $750.00 plus costs - paid thru probation, restitution of $1716.79 (including VW Surcharge) - paid at not less than $200.00/month commencing 30 days after release from incarceration, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru if deemed necessary by P&P, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores, maintain/obtain full time employment, 150 hours of community service - to be completed within the first year of probation, attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting each week, no contact with victim (T.D.), 30 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20 - credit for 1 day only if revoked - report by 8:30 AM on or before 7/31/15, pay court appointed attorney fees once submitted (10 days) - commence same payment plan one released from incarceration, no possession of firearms or body armor, no voting rights, submit DNA sample, right to appeal.

Defendant Russell E Zillmer in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:57 am. Has information (mirrors) waive further reading. NG to all counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Called 3:02 pm. Russell Zillmer in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson who appears via phone. State appears by JBC. Ferguson makes statement willing to waive PH and Zillmer has provided waiver to the court. Court goes thru the waiver and finds that defendant is waiving his right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently, court accepts waiver, finds probable cause, binds over - State has filed INFO (mirrors complaint) and Ferguson asks for another date for ARGN - 6/24/15 10 a.m. bond continued.

Defendant Russell E Zillmer in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:08 pm. Have complaint waive reading - asks for PH and waive time limits. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Russell E Zillmer in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:10 AM. Zillmer has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Zillmer wants an attorney, can afford his own. Court sets for AIA, continues bond, has given DNA sample, collaquey on rights for expungement on DNA, explains DNA process.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Tom Dehart. Not to enter into any taverns or bars.
